flex2.compiler.config

Class ConfigurationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • flex2.compiler.config.ConfigurationInfo
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdvancedConfigurationInfo

    public class ConfigurationInfo
extends Object
    The base class used for get*Info() methods. It allows configuration objects to provide information about a configuration option. For example, whether it's hidden, deprecated, advanced, etc. Subclasses should override ConfigurationInfo's methods to change the defaults.
    Author:
    Roger Gonzalez

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConfigurationInfo()
      This ctor is used when everything can be introspected off the setter method, or else when the names/types are provided by method overrides rather than ctor arguments
      ConfigurationInfo(int argcount)
      Simple ctor for restricting the number of arguments.
      ConfigurationInfo(int argcount, String argname)
      Use this ctor when you want to set a single list of some number of identically named args
      ConfigurationInfo(int argcount, String[] argnames)
      More unusual ctor, this would let you have the first few args named one thing, the rest named something else.
      ConfigurationInfo(String[] argnames)
      Simple ctor for naming the arguments.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigurationInfo

        public ConfigurationInfo()
        This ctor is used when everything can be introspected off the setter method, or else when the names/types are provided by method overrides rather than ctor arguments

      • ConfigurationInfo

        public ConfigurationInfo(int argcount)
        Simple ctor for restricting the number of arguments.
        Parameters:
        argcount - number of args, -1 for an infinite list

      • ConfigurationInfo

        public ConfigurationInfo(String[] argnames)
        Simple ctor for naming the arguments.
        Parameters:
        argnames - list of argnames, argcount will default to # of elements

      • ConfigurationInfo

        public ConfigurationInfo(int argcount,
                 String argname)
        Use this ctor when you want to set a single list of some number of identically named args
        Parameters:
        argcount - number of arguments (-1 for infinite)
        argname - name of each argument

      • ConfigurationInfo

        public ConfigurationInfo(int argcount,
                 String[] argnames)
        More unusual ctor, this would let you have the first few args named one thing, the rest named something else. It is far more likely that you want a constrained list of names or else an arbitrary list of identical names.
        Parameters:
        argcount - number of arguments
        argnames - array of argument names

    • Method Detail

      • getArgCount

        public final int getArgCount()

      • getArgName

        public String getArgName(int argnum)
        Return the name of each parameter. The default implementation is usually sufficient for simple cases, but one could do wacky things here like support an infinite list of alternating arg names.
        Parameters:
        argnum -
        Returns:
        name of argument

      • getArgType

        public final Class getArgType(int argnum)
        Return the type of each parameter. This is computed based on your setter, and cannot be overridden
        Parameters:
        argnum -

      • getPrerequisites

        public String[] getPrerequisites()
        Return variable names that should be set before this one. The buffer is always set such that it tries to set all variables at a given level before setting child values, but you could override by using this. Its probably a bad idea to depend on children, though. It is unnecessary to set parent vars as prerequisites, since they are implicitly set first

      • getSoftPrerequisites

        public String[] getSoftPrerequisites()
        Prerequisites which should be set before this one if they exist

      • allowMultiple

        public boolean allowMultiple()
        Variables are generally only allowed to be set once in a given file/cmdline. It is sometimes useful to allow the same set multiple times in order to aggregate values.
        Returns:
        true if the setter can be called multiple times

      • getAliases

        public String[] getAliases()
        Return an array of other names for this variable.

      • isAdvanced

        public boolean isAdvanced()
        Override to make a variable hidden by default (i.e. you need -advanced on the cmdline)

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden()
        Override to make a variable completely hidden

      • isDisplayed

        public boolean isDisplayed()
        Override to prevent printing when dumping configuration

      • isRequired

        public boolean isRequired()
        If a variable -must- be set, override this

      • isGreedy

        public boolean isGreedy()
        Magic used by the command line configurator only at the moment to decide whether this variable should eat all subsequent arguments. Useful for -help...

      • isPath

        public boolean isPath()
